isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - DISASSEMBLE - SHORT SERIES BEARING CAP ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Separate the actuating shaft from the bearing cap. The actuating shaft retainer is pinned to the bearing cap. Use a 5/64 inch drill and drill through the pin ( Figure 40).
Use a spanner wrench to remove the retainer.

You can fabricate your own spanner wrenches as required using discarded retainers and a piece of stock as a handle and two roll pins. Drill through the retainer and drive the roll pins through the retainer. Weld the stock material as a handle to the retainer ( Figure 41 and Figure 42).

figure.caption: Figure 41. Weld Stock Material to Retainer
Figure 42. Weld Stock Material to Retainer

step1.para: Carefully tap or press the actuating shaft and bearing out of the bearing cap ( Figure 43).

figure.caption: Figure 43. Press Actuating Shaft and Bearing Out of Bearing Cap

note.para: The actuating shaft and bearing are not supplied separately. No attempt should be made to remove the bearing.

step1.para: The bearing cap seals are removed by pressing them toward the inside ( Figure 44).

note.para: The high pressure seal back up washer will also be displaced with the seals, and should be recovered for re-installation with new seals, unless the high pressure seal is being replaced with a high pressure seal kit.

A second salt seal and umbrella style seal are used on most axle mount steering gears. Figure 45 details this seal arrangement. Seal replacement is the same as detailed above except the second salt seal is installed in the bearing cap.
An extended bearing cap which includes a needle bearing supports all extended shaft designs.
For seal replacement, remove actuating shaft, and use a screwdriver to pry out the salt seal. Insert a punch through the needle bearing bore and tap out the dirt and high pressure seals.
